Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. launched a solo shot against Jack Flaherty in the top of the first inning.
David Peralta mashed a two-run home run in the top of the second inning.
Gavin Lux hit a sacrifice fly to score Teoscar Hernandez in the bottom of the second inning.
Jackson Merrill hit an RBI single to score Tatis in the sixth inning.
Merrill hit a two-run home run in the eighth inning.
Xander Bogaerts hit a solo home run in the eighth inning.
Kyle Higashioka hit a solo home run in the top of the ninth inning.
Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a two-run home run in the top of the ninth inning.
Max Muncy hit a solo home run in the bottom of the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Yu Darvish reflected on his performance, stating, 'I felt like I had a really good concentration on the mound, just going batter by batter and just great focus. And I did get in trouble a little bit in the second inning, but other than that, I thought it was a pretty good night.'

Dodgers skipper Dave Roberts expressed confidence for Game Three, saying, 'I think for us saving leverage guys, having Walker go in Game 3, I feel great about that. That’s one of those that you just kind of want to wash away and get to the next day.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had to be paused in the seventh inning due to fans throwing baseballs, trash, and other objects at Jurickson Profar and Fernando Tatis Jr.
The Dodgers are 1–4 at Petco Park in 2024.
Yu Darvish is the only player to start a postseason game on the mound for both the Dodgers and Padres.
